comments.body:
Thanks for opening the PR @OliverJAsh ðŸ™‚
I think this will introduce a breaking change right? Previous consumers of `MousetrapInstance` will now need to reference it as `Mousetrap.MousetrapInstance`?
Correct. I don't think there's any way to avoid that. Most type changes are breaking changes FWIW.
Thanks for the clarification, this looks good to me. If you like, you can add your github username to the top of `index.d.ts` as a contributor.

I got below error in Angular 10:
This expression is not constructable.
  Type '{ default: MousetrapStatic; addKeycodes(keycodes: { [key: number]: string; }): void; stopCallback: (e: ExtendedKeyboardEvent, element: Element, combo: string) => boolean; ... 4 more ...; bindGlobal(keyArray: string | string[], callback: (e: ExtendedKeyboardEvent, combo: string) => any, action?: string): void; }' has no construct signatures.

@nicbarker, since these are breaking changes, should these be released as a major release version instead of minor one? This will prevent, the libraries from which are dependent on this one, from getting upgraded automatically.

Yes you're right, this shouldn't have been introduced with a PATCH version number - I made a mistake approving this. In the interim I'll revert with another minor version bump then re introduce with a major: https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/48169

IIUC, the official advice is to only bump the major version to match the version of the library the types are for.  I believe using a patch version for this change was the right thing to do. See https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/issues/25677#issuecomment-388215959.
